name: Garganey
description: The adult male has a brown head and chest, with the rest of the body, beak, and chest gray. A distinctive feature is a white eye stripe shaped like a crescent extending to the nape. Females are gray-brown.
spread_note: Breeds in Europe and western Asia, winters in sub-Saharan Africa, the Indian subcontinent, and Australasia
food_note: Aquatic plants and invertebrates, small fish, and amphibians
proportions: Length 33–41 cm, wingspan 58–69 cm, weight 0.3–0.8 kg
attractions: Prefers lowlands. Rarely upends while foraging, more often filtering food just below the water surface.
breeding: First arrived in 1988 from Bern, followed by a break. More arrived in 1997 and have bred successfully since.
